Plot: A chilling, thrilling collection of Edgar Allan Poe's poetry, introduced by best-selling author Philip Pullman The Raven . . . Annabel Lee . . . Ulalume . . . these are some of the spookiest, most macabre poems ever written, now collected in this chilling, affordable volume. Dreams The Lake Sonnet — To Science [Alone] Introduction To Helen Israfel The Valley of Unrest The City in the Sea To One in Paradise The Coliseum The Haunted Palace The Conqueror Worm Dream-Land Eulalie The Raven ["Deep in Earth"] To M.L.S___ Ulalume — A Ballad The Bells To Helen [Whitman] A Dream Within a Dream For Annie Eldorado To My Mother Annabel Lee
